Title: EFCC denies involvement in alleged raid of Felix Duke’s Lagos hotel
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission denies involvement in alleged raid of Felix Duke’s Lagos hotel . Duke, who is president of the hotel, said the raid damaged property and stole money . The hotel owner said the EFCC raided his hotel in Abule Egba area of Lagos .

Title: Farmer, lecturer, playwright: 10 facts about late Audu Ogbeh
Summary: Audu Ogbeh passed away on Saturday at the age of 78 . There is no official information on the cause of his death . During his lifetime, Ogbeh was a farmer, lecturer and playwright .

Title: Outgoing NANS JCC chair in Anambra backs Tinubu, Soludo for re-election
Summary: Outgoing NANS JCC chair in Anambra backs Tinubu, Soludo for re-election . Comrade Okoye Matthew Okpara has declared support for the re-elections of President Bola Tinubue in 2027 and Governor Chukwuma Charles Soludo .

Title: Audu Ogbeh’s death a monumental loss, says Akume
Summary: Senator George Akume has expressed deep sorrow over the death of Chief Audu Ogbeh . He described it as a monumental loss to the country . Akume, who is the Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF), said Ogbeh's death was a 'monumental loss'

Title: Audu Ogbeh was a dependable brother, David Mark mourns
Summary: Former Senate President and Interim National Chairman of the African Democratic Congress (ADC), Senator David Mark, has expressed deep sorrow over the passing of Chief Audu Innocent Ogbeh . Chief Ogbeh was a dependable brother, David Mark mourns .

Title: COAS reaffirms commitment to building future-ready Nigerian army through education
Summary: COAS reaffirms commitment to building future-ready Nigerian army through education . The army boss said there was a window of opportunity for passing out boys who intend to pursue a career in the military to get admission into the Nigeria Defence Academy .

Title: The end of Nigerian political parties, by Dele Sobowale
Summary: Dele Sobowale believes that a Nigerian political party deserves to be called one only if it represents the ideals, the aspirations and hopes of Americans . If it is anything else, it is merely a conspiracy to seize power” – US President Dwight Eisenhower .

Title: Prove we can trust you: Obi divides the North
Summary: Obi: "I will serve only one term of four years if elected President. And that vow is sacrosanct” Obi: “It is within this context that I reiterate my vow’

Title: Tinubu, Obasanjo, Obi, Mark, ACF, Mbisiogu, others mourn ex-PDP chair, Audu Ogbeh
Summary: Tinubu, Obasanjo, Obi, Mark, ACF, Mbisiogu, others mourn ex-PDP chair, Chief Audu Ogbeh . The Arewa Consultative Forum (ACF) expressed their condolences following the death of the former PDP chairman .

Title: SOUTH-SOUTH: Odigie-Oyegun tapped as Clark’s  successor
Summary: Senator Edwin Clark, a former Federal Commissioner for Information and Leader of the South-South region, departed . Odigie-Oyegun tapped as Clark’s successor . Title: Terrorists kill policeman in Iran
Summary: Jihadists killed one policeman in Iran’s restive southeastern province of Sistan-Baluchistan . The attackers were members of the Sunni jihadist group Jaish al-Adl (“Army of Justice” in Arabic) based in Pakistan . Title: Salah slams UEFA for omitting cause of Palestinian footballer’s death in tribute
Summary: UEFA posted a tribute to ‘Palestinian Pele’ Suleiman al-Obeid that did not mention that the former international died after being hit by Israeli gunfire in the Gaza Strip . Obeid, 41, was killed on Wednesday when Israeli forces “targeted people waiting for humanitarian aid in the southern Gaza Strip

Title: Remi Tinubu gets chieftaincy title in Lagos
Summary: The honour was bestowed upon her by the traditional ruler of Ikorodu, Oba Kabir Shotobi . The event was part of activities marking Shotobi’s 10th coronation anniversary . Mrs Tinubu was represented by the wife of Lagos State deputy governor, Oluremi Hamzat .

Title: Rivers APC kicks as administrator insists on August 30 LG poll
Summary: All Progressives Congress faulted plans by the state’s electoral body to proceed with local government elections on August 30 . Spokesman Darlington Nwauju said the exercise risks disenfranchising voters and breaching a Supreme Court ruling . RSIEC and the administrator have stood firm, insisting the August 30 date is non-neg
